comments.body: Usually use a goofy `k` prefix for these constants.  `kDefaultRowsPerPage`.
This is on a class, so it doesn't squat on useful namespace. We've avoided `k` in cases like that before (e.g. Checkbox.width).

I posted above about this line (and the above for `dataRowHeight`) being confusing, and the same thing applies here.

However, I also want to point out here that this class doesn't default anything (`DataTable` does).  So I think maybe you should just remove this line about the default here.
Took the approach mentioned in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/33628#discussion_r292634315
See [comment from your other PR](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/33535#discussion_r292583576) about commenting on this "default".
ditto (or better, use doc macros/templates to just insert the text automatically in both places)
TIL about doc templates :+1: . Done!
hmm, I thought we'd gotten rid of all the dragStartBehavior cases
I guess not? *shrugs*

comments.body: nit: Tha table card's optional header
Done!

In this assert statement it says header can't be null but in the comment  above. You remove the statement. It might must not be null. Meaning header can be null now. 

header != null should be removed so that it can be null

Ah, this is just so that if actions is set, then header must be set.

Basically:

| Header  | Actions | Result |
| ------------- | ------------- | ------------- |
| Null  | Null  | Good |
| Widget  | Null  | Good |
| Null  | Widget  | Assertion error |
| Widget  | Widget | Good |
Ohhh, thanks

comments.body: This is a bit tricky, as we've discussed offline. It does seem sensible, since the decoration inherited by the DataTable within the Card is unlikely to blend with the Card's own shape and border. The API doc for PaginatedDataTable needs to make this detail clear.
I added some docs now to the PaginatedDataTable to explain this.
